verses.verse: And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

If any one <WH5315> sin <WH2398>, and commit <WH4603> a trespass <WH4604> against Jehovah <WH3068>, and deal falsely <WH3584> with his neighbor <WH5997> in a matter of deposit <WH6487>, or of bargain <WH8667>, or of robbery <WH1498>, or have oppressed <WH6231> his neighbor <WH5997>,

or have found <WH4672> that which was lost <WH9>, and deal falsely <WH8267> therein <WH7650>, and swear to a lie <WH8267>; in any <WH259> of all these things that a man <WH120> doeth <WH6213>, sinning <WH2398> therein <WH2007>;

then it shall be <WH2398>, if he hath sinned, and is guilty <WH816>, that he shall restore <WH7725> that <WH1500> which he took by robbery <WH1497>, or the thing <WH6233> which he hath gotten <WH6231> by oppression <WH6487>, or the deposit which was committed <WH6485> to him <WH9>, or the lost thing which he found <WH4672>,

or any thing about which he hath sworn <WH7650> falsely <WH8267>; he shall even restore <WH7999> it in full <WH7218>, and shall add <WH3254> the fifth part <WH2549> more <WH3254> thereto <WH5414>: unto him to whom it appertaineth shall he give it <WH3117>, in the day of his being found guilty <WH819>.

And he shall bring <WH935> his trespass-offering <WH817> unto Jehovah <WH3068>, a ram <WH352> without blemish <WH8549> out of the flock <WH6629>, according to thy estimation <WH6187>, for a trespass-offering <WH817>, unto the priest <WH3548>:

and the priest <WH3548> shall make atonement <WH3722> for him before <WH6440> Jehovah <WH3068>; and he shall be forgiven <WH5545> concerning whatsoever <WH259> he doeth <WH6213> so as to be guilty thereby <WH819>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

Command <WH6680> Aaron <WH175> and his sons <WH1121>, saying <WH559>, This is the law <WH8451> of the burnt-offering <WH5930>: the burnt-offering <WH5930> shall be on the hearth <WH4169> upon the altar <WH4196> all night <WH3915> unto the morning <WH1242>; and the fire <WH784> of the altar <WH4196> shall be kept burning thereon <WH3344>.

And the priest <WH3548> shall put <WH3847> on his linen <WH906> garment <WH4055>, and his linen <WH906> breeches <WH4370> shall he put <WH3847> upon his flesh <WH1320>; and he shall take up <WH7311> the ashes <WH1880> whereto the fire <WH784> hath consumed <WH398> the burnt-offering <WH5930> on the altar <WH4196>, and he shall put <WH7760> them beside <WH681> the altar <WH4196>.

And he shall put off <WH6584> his garments <WH899>, and put on <WH3847> other <WH312> garments <WH899>, and carry forth <WH3318> the ashes <WH1880> without <WH2351> the camp <WH4264> unto a clean <WH2889> place <WH4725>.

And the fire <WH784> upon the altar <WH4196> shall be kept burning <WH3344> thereon <WH3518>, it shall not go out; and the priest <WH3548> shall burn <WH1197> wood <WH6086> on it every morning <WH1242>: and he shall lay the burnt-offering <WH5930> in order <WH6186> upon it <WH6999>, and shall burn thereon the fat <WH2459> of the peace-offerings <WH8002>.
Fire <WH784> shall be kept burning <WH3344> upon the altar <WH4196> continually <WH8548>; it shall not go out <WH3518>.
And this is the law <WH8451> of the meal-offering <WH4503>: the sons <WH1121> of Aaron <WH175> shall offer <WH7126> it before <WH6440> Jehovah <WH3068>, before <WH6440> the altar <WH4196>.

And he shall take <WH7311> up therefrom his handful <WH7062>, of the fine flour <WH5560> of the meal-offering <WH4503>, and of the oil <WH8081> thereof <WH3828>, and all the frankincense which is upon the meal-offering <WH4503>, and shall burn <WH6999> it upon the altar <WH4196> for a sweet <WH5207> savor <WH7381>, as the memorial <WH234> thereof <WH3068>, unto Jehovah.

And that which is left <WH3498> thereof shall Aaron <WH175> and his sons <WH1121> eat <WH398>: it shall be eaten <WH398> without leaven <WH4682> in a holy <WH6918> place <WH4725>; in the court <WH2691> of the tent <WH168> of meeting <WH4150> they shall eat it <WH398>.

It shall not be baken <WH644> with leaven <WH2557>. I have given <WH5414> it as their portion <WH2506> of my offerings made by fire <WH801>; it is most <WH6944> holy <WH6944>, as the sin-offering <WH2403>, and as the trespass-offering <WH817>.

Every male <WH2145> among the children <WH1121> of Aaron <WH175> shall eat <WH398> of it <WH2706>, as his portion for ever <WH5769> throughout your generations <WH1755>, from the offerings <WH801> of Jehovah <WH3068> made by fire <WH801>: whosoever toucheth <WH5060> them shall be holy <WH6942>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

This is the oblation <WH7133> of Aaron <WH175> and of his sons <WH1121>, which they shall offer <WH7126> unto Jehovah <WH3068> in the day <WH3117> when he is anointed <WH4886>: the tenth part <WH6224> of an ephah <WH374> of fine flour <WH5560> for a meal-offering <WH4503> perpetually <WH8548>, half <WH4276> of it in the morning <WH1242>, and half <WH4276> thereof in the evening <WH6153>.

On a baking-pan <WH4227> it shall be made <WH6213> with oil <WH8081>; when it is soaked <WH7246>, thou shalt bring <WH935> it in <WH7246>: in baken pieces <WH6595> shalt thou offer <WH7126> the meal-offering <WH4503> for a sweet <WH5207> savor <WH7381> unto Jehovah <WH3068>.

And the anointed <WH4899> priest <WH3548> that shall be in his stead from among his sons <WH1121> shall offer <WH6213> it <WH2706>: by a statute for ever <WH5769> it shall be wholly <WH3632> burnt <WH6999> unto Jehovah <WH3068>.
And every meal-offering <WH4503> of the priest <WH3548> shall be wholly burnt <WH3632>: it shall not be eaten <WH398>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

Speak <WH1696> unto Aaron <WH175> and to his sons <WH1121>, saying <WH559>, This is the law <WH8451> of the sin-offering <WH2403>: in the place <WH4725> where the burnt-offering <WH2403> is killed <WH7819> shall the sin-offering <WH5930> be killed <WH7819> before <WH6440> Jehovah <WH3068>: it is most <WH6944> holy <WH6944>.
The priest <WH3548> that offereth it for sin <WH2398> shall eat <WH398> it <WH6918>: in a holy place <WH4725> shall it be eaten <WH398>, in the court <WH2691> of the tent <WH168> of meeting <WH4150>.

Whatsoever shall touch <WH5060> the flesh <WH1320> thereof shall be holy <WH6942>; and when there is sprinkled <WH5137> of the blood <WH1818> thereof upon any garment <WH899>, thou shalt wash <WH3526> that whereon it was sprinkled <WH5137> in a holy <WH6918> place <WH4725>.

But the earthen <WH2789> vessel <WH3627> wherein it is boiled <WH1310> shall be broken <WH7665>; and if it be boiled <WH1310> in a brazen <WH5178> vessel <WH3627>, it shall be scoured <WH4838>, and rinsed <WH7857> in water <WH4325>.
Every male <WH2145> among the priests <WH3548> shall eat <WH398> thereof <WH6944>: it is most holy <WH6944>.

And no sin-offering <WH2403>, whereof any of the blood <WH1818> is brought <WH935> into the tent <WH168> of meeting <WH4150> to make atonement <WH3722> in the holy <WH6944> place <WH398>, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt <WH8313> with fire <WH784>.
